website_summaries.verdict: If you prefer a stainless steel rolling pin, this one is a winner. Create beautifully rolled dough with this smooth surface that has a brushed matte finish.
pros: To prevent the dough from warming too quickly, you can chill this rolling pin in the freezer
Has the cooling properties of marble stone without the heaviness
Clean up is easy by hand or dishwasher
Will not absorb any colors, odors, or flavors
cons: Can be a bit slippery compared to wooden rolling pins

customer_reviews.title: French style is the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried very much that not having rolling handles would bother me, but after using it, you immediately realize how silly those handles are. Gliding the French style pin in your hands is intuitive, and this pin is much simpler to clean. It is also more compact and fits in any drawer in my kitchen. I've primarily used this pin for pizzas and tortillas, as well as some other flat breads. As for this particular pin, it is well made, has a good heft and solid feel to it, is straight to the eye, and otherwise has no problems. And subtle flaws in the design have eluded me, if they exist, and I am perfectly happy with this pin.
customer_reviews.author: L0RD_BUG

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully finished
customer_reviews.text: It is in my freezer right now preparing to keep my dough cold. I have a bakery in Mexico and working with pie crust or rolled cookies is really hard due to the heat and humidity. ANYthing that can help keep my doughs cold longer is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: desertfox

customer_reviews.title: My fancy roller pin does the job
customer_reviews.text: Love my roller to pieces.. Im a pastry student and i neede! A roller pin for class but everyone had the same plastic roller that they couldnt differentiate from another. I searched and found this perfect roller ! My instructor called me fancy pants and he wants one now. He said it was super awesome and nice ! 🙌💫 It gets the job done and i engraved the end flat with my name! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Ms. K

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: I re-ordered a second one, because the first came in damaged. It was a manufacturing damage. Customer service from amazon were great though. The second replacement just arrived, it has marks on it. It has colorings and machinery tracks on it. The material has a very poor quality and who knows, what kind of chemicals it will release on my food. This goes back! I rather have a good wooden stick instead of this. The handling was OK. Do not expect a high quality heavier stainless steel stick. It feels very light, which gives me hard times to control my work.
customer_reviews.author: Magran

customer_reviews.title: Love this rolling pin- I pop it in the freezer ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this rolling pin- I pop it in the freezer for a few minutes before rolling out pie crusts and it works like a charm. Fits in a standard kitchen drawer and doesn't take up tons of space. Basic, but exactly what I wanted- no rolling parts that get pastry in them and have to be cleaned, not enormous like those marble ones, and much easier to clean that wood.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh WOW, why did I wait so long to switch to a stainless rolling pin? I just love this pin - the selling point for me was the ability to put it in the refrigerator to make it nice and cold for pastry. It makes a huge difference - the pastry stays ice cold. I know it's clean, too - so nice to not have to scrub it and place it someplace warm to dry out. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this item
customer_reviews.text: First time I used this it left grey flecks in my cookie dough which would dissolve and turned my dough and hands grey. Had to throw the entire batch out once I noticed. Since I bought it in preparation for holiday cooking, it was more than 30 days from purchase to use so now I'm out the money too. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Hackathorn

customer_reviews.title: Toxic chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: I opened my package and pulled out a plastic sleeve and noticed a small hole. As I opened the hole and reached in I noticed the cardboard wrapped around the rolling pin was we. I smelled it and it had a strange smell, I pulled the pin out which was wrapped in another protective sleeve and thought maybe it wasn’t exposed to the smell, I pulled it out and it did in fact have a strange odor. I washed with hot soapy water and could still smell it along with an aluminum smell. I would not use this product on food! I will be returning!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Rust
customer_reviews.text: After washing and drying, tiny rust spots showed up. Almost like it was pitted, very disappointed with quality of the stainless steal. Not sanitary if it does this.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: manufacturing quality/finish sub standard
customer_reviews.text: the design seems good although the wall thickness could be thicker, main issue is the joint along the length of the tube is still visible for ~50% of the length leaving a crack that you can feel and see. Its apparent that it can be joined without the crack because the joint is invisible for ~ half the length. I can't tell if it goes all the way thru - will water collect inside if washed in the dishwasher? I'm going to keep it and try it but the cracks are the reason for the 3 rating, its ~ twice the price of competitors so I wasn't expecting any visible surface defects.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I love the sleek design and it’s easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would had bought this years ago! This is much easier to work with than your traditional rolling pins with handles. I love the sleek design and it’s easy to clean. Another thing I like is that you can chill it in the fridge which really helps with rolling out pastry dough in the hot summer months.
customer_reviews.author: RnT

customer_reviews.title: High quality stainless steel rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolling pin! We cook all the time and this product is perfect. The stainless steel finish looks very sharp and is more hygienic and easy to clean than wooden rollers. It is very simple yet high quality, no engraved logos or anything just pure quality. I read a bunch of reviews on amazon before making a purchase and I couldn’t be happier. The price is great too. Ultra Cuisine makes great products! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite thing.
customer_reviews.text: Has just enough weight, easy to clean, moves well, and it chills quickly because it’s all metal. That last part is important for me because I enjoy making pastry (a cold rolling pin helps keep butter cooler when making puff pastry, which you need in order for it to flake properly.) I live in a high-theft area and noticed that it also seems like it’d be convenient to have on hand if someone tried to break in, though I’ve not had the need to test it in this capacity yet.
customer_reviews.author: Generic Person

customer_reviews.title: SO easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this rolling pin once so far. I'm used to my great-grandmother's heavy wooden pin (with handles). This was much lighter, but it had a comfortable feel and wasn't difficult to get used to. I can't rate its "non-stick" performance as the dough I was working with isn't sticky at all. My favorite part by far was the cleanup. Hot sudsy water, no worries about submerging it - SO easy. I'll never surrender my GGM's recipes, but her rolling pin just might be retired and used for display purposes only!
customer_reviews.author: annon

customer_reviews.title: Best pin ever!
customer_reviews.text: Since the Pandemic we have started baking. This rolling pin is awesome. I have made several pizzas, pies,cookies, and pastries. When cold, works best straight out of the freezer, easy to use, to smooth out difficult dough. Clean up is also easy. I don't blather on so, however this product rates it. Well made, don't see needing a replacement, ever, but would do so. Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Lack of weight makes it ineffective to roll out pizza
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Georges

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality - I’m very happy
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I especially love that I can put it in the fridge or the freezer or coat it in oil, water, or flour at Cetera to get the desired effect when I’m rolling out various different pastries and fondant
customer_reviews.author: Melissmia

customer_reviews.title: Love This Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic rolling pin! I just put it to a lot of use in making homemade croissants. I kept the rolling pin in the freezer and it did help with maintaining the chill required for the pastry. I was a little concerned that it may not be heavy enough for the rolling of the layers of cold dough and butter, but it worked very well. After flouring the pin well, I didn't notice any sticking. One of my favorite things about this item is the easy quick clean up. Definitely recommend for pastry baking.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: Hand washed this rolling pin and it still rusted. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: wendee

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on white fondant and it left dark gray streaks on the fondant. Not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ronna

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean, works well! What more could you want in a rolling pin?! Bought this to replace a roller with handles that was non-stick. With all the talk in the news of the dangers of PFAS, used to coat non-stick pans etc, we have wanted to make sure we were using safe items only in our kitchen and have replaced everything that was non-stick. We love this rolling pin for its safety as well as being dishwasher-safe and producing a quality rolled product more easily than with a handles-pin!
customer_reviews.author: Kris13

customer_reviews.title: Good...but might not be what you are looking for
customer_reviews.text: Definitely smooth and good looking. Was expecting a solid piece of milled metal though; it definitely is a hollow tube. You can feel, very slightly, where the weld seams are. Doesn't affect the rolling though, so it's ok. Just a little disappointed because i thought this was solid metal, and thats why it was more expensive than others. Maybe my fault if i missed that in the description.
customer_reviews.author: David Brillantes

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolling pin. The only thing i would change is the diameter. I like smaller ones. It is kind of fat, for what i need. I make pot stickers, and rolls, etc. This is pretty long...great for rolling out larger portions of dough. Very nice! Easy to clean! No worrying about bacteria!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum not stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: I like the product because, I purchased it to replace. My marble rolling pin, because I accidentally dropped it and it handles cracked. The rolling pin feels very light, I gave you guys three stars. Because you guys indicate that is stainless steel, is not stainless steel. Because stainless steel would be, it would be much heavier. This rolling pin is aluminum, because that's what it feels like. I use this rolling pin, for when I'm rolling out pastry for my pie crust.
customer_reviews.author: Kato

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to stovk to it, not easy to maneuver...returned
customer_reviews.author: Saucey

customer_reviews.title: Light weight rolling pin!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolling pin! I was online looking for a light weight but durable rolling pin that also went with the rest of my decor and kitchen utensils, and this was perfect! It’s thin and small enough that I can stash away in a drawer with a bunch of other items. It is super light, but functions well!! I also loved that this didn’t come with handles. I bake a lot, and when rolling pins have handles I tend to think that they aren’t as functional
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Great Rolling Pin
customer_reviews.text: Love this rolling pin! Such a simple design but it works so well. Very easy to use - much easier than my old one. My old one used to get gunk in the edges and I had to use a sharp knife to try to clean it out, and it was very heavy. This one is so light I didn’t think it would work well but it works better than the old wooden kind. Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Olson

customer_reviews.title: The best rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this rolling pin because it is extremely easy to clean and most dough does not stick to it. It feels balanced and solid in my hands while not being overly heavy. There are no seams, handles, or moving parts, so there is no place for dirt to collect. It is a pleasure to use. Truly an improvement over the wooden rolling pin grandma used.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolling pin! It's so much easier to use than a wooden one or one with handles. There's no worry about rolling dough out and getting lines from the edge of the rolling pin. Dough doesn't stick as much as to a wooden roller and because it's stainless steel, I'm much more confident about it getting absolutely clean.
customer_reviews.author: G. Allen

customer_reviews.title: The only rolling Pin you will ever need!
customer_reviews.text: I bake a lot and have purchased so many rolling pins only to be disappointed! Wooden ones- the dough sticks to it it’s so frustrating! It’s true what they say you get what you pay for this rolling pin is a bit on the expensive side I was sceptical when ordering this one but when I used it it was light, even flawless! The dough did not stick to it and washing was a breeze! I am so glad I ordered this one! I highly recommend getting this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful baking tool
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and length of this rolling pin, and the stainless steel is good-looking as well as perfect for rolling out any kind of dough. Because it's not a big diameter, you have excellent control for consistent rolling. This rolling pin arrived in perfect condition, and beautifully and carefully packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Theodora

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It isn't too heavy. I can understand why a baker may want different kinds of rolling pins, but I really liked this one because it was easy to maneuver and keep a generally even level to cut cookies. It was also nice that it came with a downloadable recipe book. I haven't had a chance to look at it, but I thought that was nice as was the customer service and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Spot

customer_reviews.title: Rolling Pin for Professionals
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sister who has a degree in culinary and loves to bake. It's a little smaller than I thought and it's actually silver not gold how I thought it looked in the picture. Very good quality and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Angel D

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Oh, this is the one. Buy it. It has made pie crust and beignets, and all KINDSA goodies so easy. Switched to this from a 10 - 15 year old wooden one with handles, and splinters. This one gets clean in the dishwasher. WOOT! Yup. Super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea K. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful rolling pin, medium weight. Purchased for fondant rolling, but have to add more pressure than usual. It’s not heavy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Noel

customer_reviews.title: Great Rolling Pin - Helps Keep Dough Cold
customer_reviews.text: I have really gotten into decorated cookies in a big way. My biggest problem was that the dough would get warm too fast as I was working with it and my rolling pin (that was plastic and old) wasn't helping any. Looked around and finally found this one. Easy to use and my dough stayed colder longer. So happy I found it. it is also way easier to clean than my previous plastic roller with handles.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C.

customer_reviews.title: This rolling pin is everything the seller says it is
customer_reviews.text: I love my new rolling pin. I had one of the older ones, wooden and it cracked. This one is so sleek and modern. I put it in the freezer for about 15-20 minutes before I rolled out some cookie dough and it worked like a charm. The dough rolled out so easily and did not stick to the rolling pin. It was everything the seller said it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Dough doesn’t stick!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making my own bread for a little over a year now and had a wood rolling pin. I was looking for a slimmer easier to maneuver rolling pin when I stumbled across this. It works great, it is easy to clean, and dough doesn’t stick to it like it did on my wood one. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Starr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: I recently took up making my own pizza, and got tired of the effort it took rolling out the dough with my old wooden rolling pin. And of course I immediately went in search of a new one on Amazon. This rolling pin is elegant in its simplicity, beautiful to hold and look at, and a dream to use. I love it that this can be put into the freezer, which makes the dough very happy. SO glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: KarenR

customer_reviews.title: where are the cons?
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - light-weight - easy to roll, and spray with non-stick (if you need to) - easy to clean (in the sink or in the dishwasher) - retains temperature well (if needing a cold pin for pastry crusts) Cons: There are none
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Mauve

customer_reviews.title: Watch out dough boy!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for pizza dough and it works great. I put a little olive oil on it and roll the dough out with ease. When I’m done, I throw it in the dishwasher. I haven’t had any problems with stuff sticking to it but cold water or olive oil helps prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Part of a fine baking experience.
customer_reviews.text: I made my cinnamon rolls with this rolling pin. They were uniform and delicious. I am a convert to the French rolling pin style. It works. Store in the freezer before you use it, and the dough will fall right off it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: drohan00

customer_reviews.title: French Rolling Pin - Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: This was on my daughters' wish list. Her comments were "much better than wood" - just did not like the wooden pins because of leaving possible wood chips!! Lite weight and is very versatile ! Easy to work with. My Daughter thinks it is just GREAT!!!!! Thank You!!
customer_reviews.author: Leo Fazzi Jr.

customer_reviews.title: smooth to the touch and looks so easy to use compared to my old heavy wooden rolling ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received my professional french rolling pen. I am waiting to use it during Christmas to make Portuguese pies. It is light weight, smooth to the touch and looks so easy to use compared to my old heavy wooden rolling pen I have had for 25+ years. Time for change and can't wait to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Da Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome rolling pin. Love the tapered ends. No problems with sticking as long as the item you are rolling out is floured or greased. I dont think it sticks any more then the teflon coated pin I had previously, and definitely not as bad as a wooden pin.
customer_reviews.author: JTH

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: I guess this will work good when I get used to no handle. I typically use a roller just for pie crust and I can't roll the entire dough without stop and adjusting my hands. But is cleans well and would work great for smaller pastries. Not saying it is not easy to use just have to get used to the different method
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Handles? Who needs handles?
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I ever used one with the handles. I find it way easier to use this type. Super sturdy, easy to clean and light weight but still heafty. I wonder if it dents easy tho. It's hollow so it might 🤷
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Go pro
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could live without a full size rolling pin. Wrong. Not only is this kind easy to use, the stainless is better at being nonstick than the wood kind. I don't miss handles, they now seem superfluous and in the way. I now will be more likely to seek out recipes to try my new rolling pin on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rolling pin after my wooden one split. I love this one. It stays cold which is great for keeping dough from sticking. It washes easily, and it also impressed people. It feels well made and it’s easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Place in the freezer before rolling out dough.
customer_reviews.text: This ranks up there with my tapered marble rolling pin. I love how smooth the pastry come out when the dough is rolled with this chilled rolling pin. I need to order a second one to alternate the pins and keep the other one in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Isa V-J

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this easy to clean, for those of us who love to roll out pastry, this can be refrigerated to make it really cold for the project, yielding perfect rollability. I just absolutely love it for rolling out pastry.
customer_reviews.author: Jane J.

customer_reviews.title: Best rolling pin ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the rolling pins I have used this is the easiest on my wrists. Plus, it cleans up very easy! You can stick it in the freezer to get it cold and it helps to roll the dough. We made a lot of cookies for Christmas and it made it so much easier. My daughter and my 3 year old grandson loved it too! I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: SCooke

customer_reviews.title: Not very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This rolling pin works and is easy to clean, but it's not really heavy enough. It seems to take a lot more effort than it should when I try to roll out dough or fondant.
customer_reviews.author: Erin L. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's very well made, with no seams in it to trap any food. Cleaning stainless steel is a breeze! Because it has sealed ends, I use it to pound my cabbage out when I make sauerkraut.
customer_reviews.author: glenesis

customer_reviews.title: AFTER WAITING FOR SO LONG...SO PERFECT.  LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This wasn’t available last Christmas when I wanted it, so I had to wait a little while to get...but so very worth it. LOVE IT! Just used it for the first time to roll out the dough for my Thanksgiving rolls, and it felt so good to use, worked excellent and made rolling out the dough easier. HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.author: lolly67

customer_reviews.title: best rolling pin ever
customer_reviews.text: I bake at least weekly and cook daily. This is the best rolling pin I've used and it's so easy to clean. It'll be fantastic for making croissants and other puff pastries so that the dough doesn't get too warm. I don't have a single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: SATISFIED IN DECATUR, AL
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this rolling pin to use in making biscuits, fondant and pie crust. It is very well made, easy to both use and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love this rolling pin!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this immediately to make pie crusts and then I rolled out biscuit dough and made a bunch of gingerbread men. I'm enjoying it so much! It's easy to clean and stores nicely in my baking drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Thia Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Good size and weight. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This pin is actually dual purpose. It's great for pizza dough and makes a good club! It could us a hook or loop on one end so it can be hung instead of taking up s lot of kitchen drawer space. We ended up making a shelf rack for it since we plan to get a longer one for larger pizza crusts and dedicate this one for pastry dough.
customer_reviews.author: davidwp

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of baking and this is the best rolling pin I’ve used. I want to find recipes to try just so I can have an excuse to use this. It’s lightweight but not flimsy, super easy to grip, easy to clean. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rolling Pin
customer_reviews.text: Love this rolling pin. Light. Easy to clean. Smooth. No seams anywhere. I be used less flour because dough didn't stick as much to this compared to my bamboo wood rolling pin. Perfect size for home use. Big enough to do bigger jobs. Small enough to do smaller jobs. And fits in the drawer and dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: MemlyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Buy this rolling pin, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rolling pin! Much easier and cleaner to use than the old school wooden ones with handles. I keep it in the freezer when not in use, it’s helps a ton keeping dough from sticking.
customer_reviews.author: TheFatCampKid

customer_reviews.title: Rolls on through
customer_reviews.text: I bake bread every day in a small restaurant. I have a wooden rolling pin that I really like but because of space issues, it was just too long. I was not sure how I would like a metal rolling pin, but it turned out fine. The length and weight are great. So great product and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Not your ordinary rolling pin, Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: This rolling pin, is my go to for any type of rolling, whether it is nut cracking, chicken flattening, or bread dough, this thing is strong, and a very useful tool in the kitchen. The french know their rolling pins, that is all I can say here.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Totally impressed !!
customer_reviews.text: It was light weight, but sturdy and easy to use when making my BaoPao dough. Due to the material ot was made of the dough did not stick to the roller and it was very easy to clean afterwards. I am considering getting a second one... just because 🥰 i loved this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybird

customer_reviews.title: Stainless is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. So far I've just used for pie crust. Taking the advice of another, I put this in the freezer while mixing the dough. The coolness made rolling out the round a breeze because the dough didn't stick. Size and weight feel good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: teaser 2817

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel!
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner cookie maker, I’m on the lookout for related products I could use. This is my first stainless steel rolling pin. Easy to clean, and does not feel heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: yellowgrass11

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this while searching for a replacement for my traditional wooden rolling pin. This stainless steel rolling pin is exactly as advertised, it is lightweight, easy to clean, durable, and of course does exactly what one would expect of a rolling pin. I am thrilled with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and I love how easy it is to clean with no edges or cracks, I never have to worry about food particles getting stuck or moldy!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Jane Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good weapon, excellent roller!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this rolling pin! I have severe tendinitis and the rollers with handles simply hurt me too much to use. This roller is lightweight enough to not crush dough, but robust enough to be used as a weapon if need be (God forbid).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this product..
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like this because it kept slipping.. I would rather get a rolling pin with handles. It honestly didnt even work that well in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kaykate

customer_reviews.title: Love this rolling pin!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! I was nervous getting this pin at first but after just one use I fell in love! So easy to use and clean!!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Much lighter weight than I assumed it would be but very solid design. The fact that it is all one piece and easy to clean is an added bonus
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lippitt

customer_reviews.title: Creates such even thickness!
customer_reviews.text: I love the width of this rolling pin as well as the feel of having the actual roller part in my hand. It just feels more natural to roll the dough with the palm of my hand. I also like that it's stainless--that means no germs hiding in the wood. Tosses it in the dishwasher, back into the freezer, ready for next use. Awesome! Buying one for my daughter-in-law who loves to bake!
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Wood

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and maneuver, I love the fact that you can put it in the freezer for when rolling out pie crust and biscuit dough that you want to keep cold and that it can go into the dishwasher to be sterilized.
customer_reviews.author: sidney hoyle

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy as I expected. Very light weight. Seems to work okay. Three stars for the weight of the item. A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Best Rolling Pin Ever
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with the rolling pin. First off looks classy and expensive. I gave it as a birthday gift and the recipient was very pleased. We are going to be rolling out glass modeling clay to make Xmas decorations. I think the stainless steel will work so much better than wood.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Arrived fast!. I'm sold on this rolling pin. I have always used a wooden pin but LOVE the stainless so much more! Would definitely recommend this product and this seller in the future. I was really please with how fast it arrived!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Melcher

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time to make many pizza's and it rolled out the crust better than any other roller I have tried! No sticking! I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Kewl
customer_reviews.text: First time having a stainless steel rolling pin and it is great! I’m a germaphob and live that I can put this in the dishwasher. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Eagles wings

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! So glad I found this before purchasing a ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! So glad I found this before purchasing a wooden one. First time I used to roll out dough from my bread machine it worked perfectly with no flour & not chilled! Darn...wish these were around back in the 70's.
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: I love this rolling pin
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolling pin! I inherited my grandmother's wooden one, but, due to a stroke AND advancing arthritis...... well, it became awkward and almost impossible to use! This stainless steel marvel has gotten me back to baking again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use 🤩
customer_reviews.text: I never thought that I'd like a rolling pin without handles, but I really love this one! It's easy to use and super easy to wash !

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all of my life!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband and I don't know who uses it more, me or him! We have 2 wooden rolling pins we have had for years and use them all of the time, BUT for dough this is so easy to use! t The chill factor alone makes it an amazing product but the clean up makes it all the better!

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This roller works great on puff pastry. Is super easy to maneuver and is super light. I am never going back to a regular dough roller after trying this.

customer_reviews.title: Number 1 important item in the artillery of baking is "The French Rolling Pin"
customer_reviews.text: I really love this rolling pin.. I love the feel of it and it really is very manageable, unlike the wooden rolling pins. Quite easy to clean as well. I'm glad I purchased it!

customer_reviews.text: Love this rolling pin. Well made, good quality, clean welds that are smooth. Light weight. Would buy again.

customer_reviews.text: Great for rolling out everything I’ve tried, including sugar cookies and noodles. Dough doesn’t stick, and it is dishwasher safe. Natural movement compared to traditional handled pins, which is all I had used till now.

customer_reviews.title: Best Fondant roller Ever
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best thing I’ve purchased all year long I was rolling out fondant for my first fondant cake and this made it absolutely easy I’m super happy with my purchase and I’m glad I did not go with the traditional rubber roller this is awesome thank you for also having such a great deal on it I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: jellybean

customer_reviews.title: but it does look beautiful and feels sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it yet, but it does look beautiful and feels sturdy. I can imagine using it well, especially in my puff pastry and croissant recipes where the dough must always be kept chilled. This is chillable (new word), and easily cleanable. I was also impressed with the personal email that I got from the business to make sure that I was satisfied with my purchase.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!

customer_reviews.text: Works well ..put in freezer before use so dough doesn’t stick and get warm.

customer_reviews.title: Great size and easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this rolling pen is dishwasher safe. I am a pastry chef and it makes it much easier for cleanup. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorite new items in our kitchen arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my significant other who worked for 8 years as a sous chef. We had other rolling pins that didn't stand the test of time. He particularly loves this rolling pin because it maintains temperature better than any other one we've used. Whether we are making cookies, pastry, or pasta, this rolling pin is perfect and easy to clean. I'll likely purchase more of these as gifts for family members who don't know what they are missing.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and the Best!
customer_reviews.text: The Absolute Best! This rolling pin is beautiful and functional. Without doubt it rolls the dough perfectly. And the sleek look pleases me every time I use it. Buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ann R. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I love this rolling pin. Stainless steel is easy to clean! Dishwasher safe. It's all one piece, no moving or rolling parts for food to get stuck in. The ruler etched into the rolling pin allows me to roll my dough out to the perfect size. I can keep it in the freezer/fridge and it gets super cold, which keeps my butter-based dough at the right temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why anyone would use a wood rolling pin, this is more sanitary, ergonomically easy to use and does the job Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Angie

product_meta.title: Professional French Rolling Pin for Baking - 15.75" Smooth Stainless Steel Metal has Tapered Design Best for Fondant, Pie Crust, Cookie, Pastry, Pasta, Pizza Dough - Chef Baker Roller by Ultra Cuisine
feature_bullets: Create perfectly rolled dough with the smooth 100% stainless steel non-porous surface. Roll cookies, pie, fondant, pasta, pizza, ravioli, tortillas, dumpling & roti with this premium bakeware tool

Sense the thickness of the dough with the slightly tapered pin under your hands. Unlike rollers with handles, the tactile feedback of the French rod design lets you know the amount of pressure to use.
Chill the rolling pin in the freezer to prevent dough from becoming warm too quickly. Stainless steel has the cooling properties of marble stone without the heaviness.
Designed with a brushed matte finish of stainless steel that will not absorb any odors, colors or flavors like maple, cherry, walnut or mahogany wood rolling pins can, making it more hygienic.

Kid friendly for clay, play doh, arts and crafts. 15.75" long, 1.5" diameter, weighs 10 oz & cleans easily by hand or dishwasher. Enjoy a 1-Year Satisfaction Guarantee when ordered from Virtuosoul LLC
